intro: Chiropetalum berteroanum var. psiladenium, commonly known as the small-leaved chiropetalum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded understories of forests. This variant is distinguished by its smaller leaf size compared to other varieties within the species.
